00057 #define DEG2RAD(x) ((x * M_PI) / 180.0)

00066    template <class T>
00067    class Vector2 
00068    {
00069       public:
00070          union 
00071          {
00075                T x;
00076                 
00081                T s; 
00082          };
00083         
00084          union 
00085          {
00089                T y; 
00090                 
00095                T t; 
00096          };
00097 
00098          //----------------[ constructors ]--------------------------
00102          Vector2() : x(0),y(0)
00103          {      }
00104         
00105         
00106 
00112          Vector2(T nx, T ny) : x(nx), y(ny)
00113          {      }
00114 
00115 
00120          Vector2(const Vector2<T>& src)
00121             : x(src.x), y(src.y) 
00122          {       }
00123 
00124 
00129          template <class FromT>
00130          Vector2(const Vector2<FromT>& src)
00131             : x(static_cast<T>(src.x)),
00132               y(static_cast<T>(src.y))
00133          {       }
00134         
00135         
00136          //----------------[ access operators ]-------------------
00141          template <class FromT>
00142          Vector2<T>& operator=(const Vector2<FromT>& rhs)
00143          {
00144             x = static_cast<T>(rhs.x);
00145             y = static_cast<T>(rhs.y);
00146             return * this;
00147          }
00148 
00153          Vector2<T>& operator=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00154          {
00155             x = rhs.x;
00156             y = rhs.y;
00157             return * this;
00158          }
00159 
00160 
00167          T& operator[](int n)
00168          {
00169             assert(n >= 0 && n <= 1);
00170             if (0 == n) return x;
00171             else
00172                return y;
00173          }
00174         
00175         
00176          //---------------[ vector aritmetic operator ]--------------
00181          Vector2<T> operator+(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00182          {
00183             return Vector2<T> (x + rhs.x, y + rhs.y);
00184          }
00185 
00190          Vector2<T> operator-(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00191          {
00192             return Vector2<T> (x - rhs.x, y - rhs.y);
00193          }
00194 
00199          Vector2<T> operator*(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const
00200          {
00201             return Vector2<T> (x * rhs.x, y * rhs.y);
00202          }
00203 
00208          Vector2<T> operator/(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const 
00209          {
00210             return Vector2<T> (x / rhs.x, y / rhs.y);
00211          }
00212 
00217          Vector2<T>& operator+=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00218          {
00219             x += rhs.x;
00220             y += rhs.y;
00221             return * this;
00222          }
00223 
00228          Vector2<T>& operator-=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00229          {
00230             x -= rhs.x;
00231             y -= rhs.y;
00232             return * this;
00233          }
00234         
00239          Vector2<T>& operator*=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00240          {
00241             x *= rhs.x;
00242             y *= rhs.y;
00243             return * this;
00244          }
00245         
00250          Vector2<T>& operator/=(const Vector2<T>& rhs)
00251          {
00252             x /= rhs.x;
00253             y /= rhs.y;
00254             return * this;
00255          }
00256 
00257          //--------------[ scalar vector operator ]--------------------
00262          Vector2<T> operator+(T rhs) const
00263          {
00264             return Vector2<T> (x + rhs, y + rhs);
00265          }
00266         
00271          Vector2<T> operator-(T rhs) const
00272          {
00273             return Vector2<T> (x - rhs, y - rhs);
00274          }
00275         
00280          Vector2<T> operator*(T rhs) const
00281          {
00282             return Vector2<T> (x * rhs, y * rhs);
00283          }
00284         
00289          Vector2<T> operator/(T rhs) const
00290          {
00291             return Vector2<T> (x / rhs, y / rhs);
00292          }
00293 
00298          Vector2<T>& operator+=(T rhs)
00299          {
00300             x += rhs;
00301             y += rhs;
00302             return * this;
00303          }
00304 
00309          Vector2<T>& operator-=(T rhs) 
00310          {
00311             x -= rhs;
00312             y -= rhs;
00313             return * this;
00314          }
00315 
00320          Vector2<T>& operator*=(T rhs)
00321          {
00322             x *= rhs;
00323             y *= rhs;
00324             return * this;
00325          }
00326 
00331          Vector2<T>& operator/=(T rhs) 
00332          {
00333             x /= rhs;
00334             y /= rhs;
00335             return * this;
00336          }
00337 
00338          //--------------[ equality operator ]------------------------
00346          bool operator==(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const 
00347          {
00348             return (std::abs(x - rhs.x) < EPSILON) && (std::abs(y - rhs.y) < EPSILON);
00349          }
00350 
00351         
00357          bool operator!=(const Vector2<T>& rhs) const { return ! (*this == rhs); }
00358 
00359          //-------------[ size operations ]---------------------------
00364          T length()
00365          {
00366             return (T)std::sqrt(x * x + y * y);
00367          }
00368 
00372          void normalize()
00373          {
00374             T s = length();
00375             x /= s;
00376             y /= s;
00377          }
00378 
00386          T lengthSq()
00387          {
00388             return x * x + y * y;
00389          }
00390         
00391          //--------------[ misc. operations ]-----------------------
00401          Vector2<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector2<T>& r) const
00402          {
00403             return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;      
00404          }
00405         
00406     
00407          //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
00413          operator T*(){ return (T*) this; }
00419          operator const T*() const { return (const T*) this; }
00420 
00421          //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
00428          friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector2<T>& rhs) 
00429          {
00430             lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "]";
00431             return lhs;
00432          }
00433 
00434 
00435    };

00450    template <class T>
00451    class Vector3 
00452    {
00453       public:
00454          //T x, y, z;
00455          union
00456          {
00460                T x;
00461                 
00466                T s;
00467                 
00472                T r; 
00473          };
00474         
00475          union
00476          {
00480                T y; 
00485                T t; 
00490                T g; 
00491          };
00492         
00493          union
00494          {
00498                T z;
00499                 
00504                T u; 
00509                T b; 
00510          };
00511         
00512          //----------------[ constructors ]--------------------------
00516          Vector3() : x(0),y(0),z(0)
00517          {      }
00518 
00525          Vector3(T nx, T ny, T nz) : x(nx),y(ny),z(nz)
00526          {      }
00527 
00532          Vector3(const Vector3<T>& src)
00533             : x(src.x), y(src.y), z(src.z)
00534          {}
00535          
00540          template <class FromT>
00541          Vector3(const Vector3<FromT>& src)
00542             : x(static_cast<T>(src.x)),
00543               y(static_cast<T>(src.y)),
00544               z(static_cast<T>(src.z))
00545          {}
00546         
00547         
00548          //----------------[ access operators ]-------------------
00553          Vector3<T> operator=(const Vector3<T>& rhs) 
00554          {
00555             x = rhs.x;
00556             y = rhs.y;
00557             z = rhs.z;
00558             return * this;
00559          }
00560 
00565          template <class FromT>
00566          Vector3<T> operator=(const Vector3<FromT>& rhs)
00567          {
00568             x = static_cast<T>(rhs.x);
00569             y = static_cast<T>(rhs.y);
00570             z = static_cast<T>(rhs.z);
00571             return * this;
00572          }
00573 
00581          T & operator[](int n)
00582          {
00583             assert(n >= 0 && n <= 2);
00584             if (0 == n) return x;
00585             else if (1 == n) return y;
00586             else
00587                return z;
00588          }
00589 
00590 
00591          //---------------[ vector aritmetic operator ]--------------
00596          Vector3<T> operator+(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const 
00597          {
00598             return Vector3<T> (x + rhs.x, y + rhs.y, z + rhs.z);
00599          }
00600         
00605          Vector3<T> operator-(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const 
00606          {
00607             return Vector3<T> (x - rhs.x, y - rhs.y, z - rhs.z);
00608          }
00609         
00614          Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const 
00615          {
00616             return Vector3<T> (x * rhs.x, y * rhs.y, z * rhs.z);
00617          }
00618 
00623          Vector3<T> operator/(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const 
00624          {
00625             return Vector3<T> (x / rhs.x, y / rhs.y, z / rhs.z);
00626          }
00627 
00632          Vector3<T>& operator+=(const Vector3<T>& rhs) 
00633          {
00634             x += rhs.x;
00635             y += rhs.y;
00636             z += rhs.z;
00637             return * this;
00638          }
00639 
00644          Vector3<T>& operator-=(const Vector3<T>& rhs) 
00645          {
00646             x -= rhs.x;
00647             y -= rhs.y;
00648             z -= rhs.z;
00649             return * this;
00650          }
00651 
00656          Vector3<T>& operator*=(const Vector3<T>& rhs) 
00657          {
00658             x *= rhs.x;
00659             y *= rhs.y;
00660             z *= rhs.z;
00661             return * this;
00662          }
00663 
00668          Vector3<T>& operator/=(const Vector3<T>& rhs) 
00669          {
00670             x /= rhs.x;
00671             y /= rhs.y;
00672             z /= rhs.z;
00673             return * this;
00674          }
00675 
00680          T dotProduct(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const 
00681          {
00682             return x * rhs.x + y * rhs.y + z * rhs.z;
00683          }
00684 
00689          Vector3<T> crossProduct(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const 
00690          {
00691             return Vector3<T> (y * rhs.z - rhs.y * z, z * rhs.x - rhs.z * x, x * rhs.y - rhs.x * y);
00692          }
00693         
00694 
00695          //--------------[ scalar vector operator ]--------------------
00700          Vector3<T> operator+(T rhs) const 
00701          {
00702             return Vector3<T> (x + rhs, y + rhs, z + rhs);
00703          }
00704 
00709          Vector3<T> operator-(T rhs) const 
00710          {
00711             return Vector3<T> (x - rhs, y - rhs, z - rhs);
00712          }
00713 
00718          Vector3<T> operator*(T rhs) const 
00719          {
00720             return Vector3<T> (x * rhs, y * rhs, z * rhs);
00721          }
00722         
00727          Vector3<T> operator/(T rhs) const 
00728          {
00729             return Vector3<T> (x / rhs, y / rhs, z / rhs);
00730          }
00731         
00736          Vector3<T>& operator+=(T rhs) 
00737          {
00738             x += rhs;
00739             y += rhs;
00740             z += rhs;
00741             return * this;
00742          }
00743 
00748          Vector3<T>& operator-=(T rhs) 
00749          {
00750             x -= rhs;
00751             y -= rhs;
00752             z -= rhs;
00753             return * this;
00754          }
00755 
00760          Vector3<T>& operator*=(T rhs) 
00761          {
00762             x *= rhs;
00763             y *= rhs;
00764             z *= rhs;
00765             return * this;
00766          }
00767 
00772          Vector3<T>& operator/=(T rhs) 
00773          {
00774             x /= rhs;
00775             y /= rhs;
00776             z /= rhs;
00777             return * this;
00778          }
00779 
00780          //--------------[ equiality operator ]------------------------
00788          bool operator==(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
00789          {
00790             return std::fabs(x - rhs.x) < EPSILON 
00791                && std::fabs(y - rhs.y) < EPSILON 
00792                && std::fabs(z - rhs.z) < EPSILON;
00793          }
00794 
00800          bool operator!=(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const { return !(*this == rhs); }
00801 
00802          //-------------[ size operations ]---------------------------
00807          T length() const 
00808          {
00809             return (T)std::sqrt(x * x + y * y + z * z);
00810          }
00811         
00819          T lengthSq() const 
00820          {
00821             return x * x + y * y + z * z;
00822          }
00823         
00827          void normalize() 
00828          {
00829             T s = length();
00830             x /= s;
00831             y /= s;
00832             z /= s;
00833          }
00834 
00835          //------------[ other operations ]---------------------------
00842          void rotate(T ax, T ay, T az) 
00843          {
00844             T a = cos(DEG2RAD(ax));
00845             T b = sin(DEG2RAD(ax));
00846             T c = cos(DEG2RAD(ay));
00847             T d = sin(DEG2RAD(ay));
00848             T e = cos(DEG2RAD(az));
00849             T f = sin(DEG2RAD(az));
00850             T nx = c * e * x - c * f * y + d * z;
00851             T ny = (a * f + b * d * e) * x + (a * e - b * d * f) * y - b * c * z;
00852             T nz = (b * f - a * d * e) * x + (a * d * f + b * e) * y + a * c * z;
00853             x = nx; y = ny; z = nz;
00854                 
00855                 
00856          }
00857         
00867          Vector3<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector3<T>& r) const
00868          {
00869             return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;      
00870          }
00871         
00872     
00873 
00874 
00875 
00876          //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
00877         
00883          operator T*(){ return (T*) this; }
00884 
00890          operator const T*() const { return (const T*) this; }
00891 
00892          //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
00899          friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector3<T> rhs) 
00900          {
00901             lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "," << rhs.z  << "]";
00902             return lhs;
00903          }
00904         
00905    };

00916    template <class T>
00917    class Vector4{
00918       public:
00919 
00920          union 
00921          { 
00926                T r; 
00930                T x; 
00931          };
00932         
00933          union 
00934          { 
00939                T g; 
00943                T y; 
00944          };
00945         
00946          union 
00947          {
00952                T b; 
00956                T z; 
00957          };
00958         
00959          union 
00960          {
00965                T a; 
00971                T w; 
00972          };
00973         
00974          //----------------[ constructors ]--------------------------
00978          Vector4() : x(0),y(0),z(0),w(0)
00979          { }
00980 
00981 
00989          Vector4(T nx, T ny, T nz, T nw) : x(nx), y(ny), z(nz), w(nw)
00990          { }
00991 
00996          Vector4(const Vector4<T>& src)
00997             : x(src.x), y(src.y), z(src.z), w(src.w)
00998          {}
00999 
01004          template <class FromT>
01005          Vector4(const Vector4<FromT>& src)
01006             : x(static_cast<T>(src.x)),
01007               y(static_cast<T>(src.y)),
01008               z(static_cast<T>(src.z)),
01009               w(static_cast<T>(src.w))
01010          {}
01011 
01012 
01013          //----------------[ access operators ]-------------------
01018          Vector4<T> operator=(const Vector4<T>& rhs) 
01019          {
01020             x = rhs.x;
01021             y = rhs.y;
01022             z = rhs.z;
01023             w = rhs.w;
01024             return * this;
01025          }
01026 
01031          template<class FromT>
01032          Vector4<T> operator=(const Vector4<FromT>& rhs) 
01033          {
01034             x = static_cast<T>(rhs.x);
01035             y = static_cast<T>(rhs.y);
01036             z = static_cast<T>(rhs.z);
01037             w = static_cast<T>(rhs.w);
01038             return * this;
01039          }
01040 
01041 
01049          T & operator[](int n) 
01050          {
01051             assert(n >= 0 && n <= 3);
01052             if (0 == n) return x;
01053             else if (1 == n) return y;
01054             else if (2 == n) return z;
01055             else return w;
01056          }
01057 
01058 
01059          //---------------[ vector aritmetic operator ]--------------
01064          Vector4<T> operator+(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const 
01065          {
01066             return Vector4<T> (x + rhs.x, y + rhs.y, z + rhs.z, w + rhs.w);
01067          }
01068 
01073          Vector4<T> operator-(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const 
01074          {
01075             return Vector4<T> (x - rhs.x, y - rhs.y, z - rhs.z, w - rhs.w);
01076          }
01077

01083          {
01084             return Vector4<T> (x * rhs.x, y * rhs.y, z * rhs.z, w * rhs.w);
01085          }
01086

01092          {

01271 
01275          void normalize() 
01276          {
01277             T s = length();
01278             x /= s;
01279             y /= s;
01280             z /= s;
01281             w /= s;
01282          }
01283         
01291          T lengthSq() const 
01292          {
01293             return x * x + y * y + z * z + w * w;
01294          }
01295         
01296          //--------------[ misc. operations ]-----------------------
01306          Vector4<T> lerp(T fact, const Vector4<T>& r) const
01307          {
01308             return (*this) + (r - (*this)) * fact;      
01309          }
01310         
01311     
01312         
01313 
01314          //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
01315         
01321          operator T*(){ return (T*) this; }
01322         
01323         
01329          operator const T*() const { return (const T*) this; }
01330 
01331          //-------------[ output operator ]------------------------
01338          friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& lhs, const Vector4<T>& rhs) 
01339          {
01340             lhs << "[" << rhs.x << "," << rhs.y << "," << rhs.z << "," << rhs.w << "]";
01341             return lhs;
01342          }
01343    };
01344 
01346    typedef Vector4<float> Vector4f;
01348    typedef Vector4<double> Vector4d;

01358    template <class T>
01359    class Matrix3 
01360    {
01361       public:
01363          T data[9];
01364         
01365          //--------------------------[ constructors ]-------------------------------
01369          Matrix3() 
01370          {
01371             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01372                data[i] = (i % 4) ? 0 : 1;
01373          }
01374 
01379          Matrix3(const T * dt)
01380          {
01381             std::memcpy(data, dt, sizeof(T) * 9); 
01382          }
01383 
01388          Matrix3(const Matrix3<T>& src)
01389          {
01390             std::memcpy(data, src.data, sizeof(T) * 9);
01391          }
01392 
01397          template<class FromT>
01398          Matrix3(const Matrix3<FromT>& src)
01399          {
01400             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01401             {
01402                data[i] = static_cast<T>(src.data[i]);
01403             }
01404          }
01405         
01409          void identity()
01410          {
01411             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01412                data[i] = (i % 4) ? 0 : 1;
01413          }
01414         
01415         
01416 
01423          static Matrix3<T> createRotationAroundAxis(T a, T b, T c)
01424          {
01425             Matrix3<T> ma, mb, mc;
01426             float ac = cos(a);
01427             float as = sin(a);
01428             float bc = cos(b);
01429             float bs = sin(b);
01430             float cc = cos(c);
01431             float cs = sin(c);
01432 
01433             ma.at(1,1) = ac;
01434             ma.at(2,1) = as;
01435             ma.at(1,2) = -as;
01436             ma.at(2,2) = ac;
01437 
01438             mb.at(0,0) = bc;
01439             mb.at(2,0) = -bs;
01440             mb.at(0,2) = bs;
01441             mb.at(2,2) = bc;
01442 
01443             mc.at(0,0) = cc;
01444             mc.at(1,0) = cs;
01445             mc.at(0,1) = -cs;
01446             mc.at(1,1) = cc;
01447 
01448             Matrix3<T> ret = ma * mb * mc;
01449             return ret;
01450          }
01451 
01455          template <class It>
01456          static Matrix3<T> fromOde(const It* mat)
01457          {
01458             Matrix3<T> ret;
01459             for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01460             {
01461                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01462                {
01463                   ret.at(i,j) = static_cast<T>(mat[j * 4 + i]);
01464                }
01465             }
01466             return ret;
01467          }
01468 
01469 
01470          //---------------------[ equiality operators ]------------------------------
01479          bool operator==(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01480          {
01481             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01482             {
01483                if (std::fabs(data[i] - rhs.data[i]) >= EPSILON)
01484                   return false;
01485             }
01486             return true;
01487          }
01488         
01489         
01495          bool operator!=(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01496          {
01497             return !(*this == rhs);
01498          }
01499         
01500 
01501          //---------------------[ access operators ]---------------------------------
01507          T& at(int x, int y) 
01508          {
01509             assert(x >= 0 && x < 3);
01510             assert(y >= 0 && y < 3);
01511             return data[x * 3 + y];
01512          }
01513 
01519          const T& at(int x, int y) const 
01520          {
01521             assert(x >= 0 && x < 3);
01522             assert(y >= 0 && y < 3);
01523             return data[x * 3 + y];
01524          }
01525 
01530          Matrix3<T>& operator=(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) 
01531          {
01532             std::memcpy(data, rhs.data, sizeof(T) * 9);
01533             return * this;
01534          }
01535 
01540          template<class FromT>
01541          Matrix3<T>& operator=(const Matrix3<FromT>& rhs) 
01542          {
01543             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01544             {
01545                data[i] = static_cast<T>(rhs.data[i]);
01546             }
01547             return * this;
01548          }
01549 
01554          Matrix3<T>& operator=(const T* rhs) 
01555          {
01556             std::memcpy(data, rhs, sizeof(T) * 9);
01557             return * this;
01558          }
01559 
01560 
01561          /*Matrix3<T> & operator=(const double* m)
01562            {
01563            for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) data[i] = (T)m[i];
01564            return * this;
01565            }*/
01566         
01567          //--------------------[ matrix with matrix operations ]---------------------
01572          Matrix3<T> operator+(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01573          {
01574             Matrix3<T> ret;
01575             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01576                ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs.data[i];
01577             return ret;
01578          }
01579         
01584          Matrix3<T> operator-(const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01585          {
01586             Matrix3<T> ret;
01587             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01588                ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs.data[i];
01589             return ret;
01590          }
01591         
01592          //--------------------[ matrix with scalar operations ]---------------------
01597          Matrix3<T> operator+(T rhs) const
01598          {
01599             Matrix3<T> ret;
01600             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01601                ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs;
01602             return ret;
01603          }
01604         
01609          Matrix3<T> operator-(T rhs) const
01610          {
01611             Matrix3<T> ret;
01612             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01613                ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs;
01614             return ret;
01615          }
01616         
01621          Matrix3<T> operator*(T rhs) const
01622          {
01623             Matrix3<T> ret;
01624             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01625                ret.data[i] = data[i] * rhs;
01626             return ret;
01627          }
01628         
01633          Matrix3<T> operator/(T rhs) const
01634          {
01635             Matrix3<T> ret;
01636             for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++)
01637                ret.data[i] = data[i] / rhs;
01638             return ret;
01639          }
01640         
01641 
01642          //--------------------[ multiply operators ]--------------------------------
01647          Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
01648          {
01649             return Vector3<T>(
01650                data[0] * rhs.x + data[3] * rhs.y + data[6] * rhs.z,
01651                data[1] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[7] * rhs.z,
01652                data[2] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[8] * rhs.z
01653                );
01654          }
01655 
01660          Matrix3<T> operator*(Matrix3<T> rhs) const 
01661          {
01662             static Matrix3<T> w;
01663             for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) 
01664             {
01665                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) 
01666                {
01667                   T n = 0;
01668                   for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) n += rhs.at(i, k) * at(k, j);
01669                   w.at(i, j) = n;
01670                }
01671             }
01672             return w;
01673                 
01674          }
01675         
01676         
01677          //---------------------------[ misc operations ]----------------------------
01681          Matrix3<T> transpose()
01682          {
01683             Matrix3<T> ret;
01684             for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01685             {
01686                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01687                {
01688                   ret.at(i,j) = at(j,i);
01689                }
01690             }
01691             return ret;
01692          }
01693         
01703          Matrix3<T> lerp(T fact, const Matrix3<T>& rhs) const
01704          {
01705             Matrix3<T> ret = (*this) + (rhs - (*this)) * fact;
01706             return ret;         
01707          }
01708 
01709     
01710          //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
01711         
01717          operator T*(){ return (T*) data; }
01718         
01724          operator const T*() const { return (const T*) data; }
01725 
01726          //----------[ output operator ]----------------------------
01733          friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& lhs, const Matrix3<T>& rhs) 
01734          {
01735             for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01736             {
01737                lhs << "|\t";
01738                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01739                {
01740                   lhs << rhs.at(j,i) << "\t";
01741                }
01742                lhs << "|" << std::endl;
01743             }
01744             return lhs;
01745          }
01746     
01747    };
01748

01752    typedef Matrix3<double> Matrix3d;

01759    template <class T>
01760    class Matrix4 
01761    {
01762       public:
01764          T data[16];
01765         
01766          //--------------------------[ constructors ]-------------------------------
01770          Matrix4() 
01771          {
01772             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01773                data[i] = (i % 5) ? 0 : 1;
01774          }
01775 
01780          Matrix4(const T * dt) 
01781          {
01782             std::memcpy(data, dt, sizeof(T) * 16); 
01783          }
01784 
01789          Matrix4(const Matrix4<T>& src)
01790          {
01791             std::memcpy(data, src.data, sizeof(T) * 16);
01792          }
01793         
01798          template <class FromT>
01799          Matrix4(const Matrix4<FromT>& src)
01800          {
01801             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01802             {
01803                data[i] = static_cast<T>(src.data[i]);
01804             }
01805          }
01806 
01810          void identity()
01811          {
01812             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01813                data[i] = (i % 5) ? 0 : 1;
01814          }
01815         
01816         
01817 
01824          static Matrix4<T> createRotationAroundAxis(T a, T b, T c)
01825          {
01826             Matrix4<T> ma, mb, mc;
01827             float ac = cos(a);
01828             float as = sin(a);
01829             float bc = cos(b);
01830             float bs = sin(b);
01831             float cc = cos(c);
01832             float cs = sin(c);
01833 
01834             ma.at(1,1) = ac;
01835             ma.at(2,1) = as;
01836             ma.at(1,2) = -as;
01837             ma.at(2,2) = ac;
01838 
01839             mb.at(0,0) = bc;
01840             mb.at(2,0) = -bs;
01841             mb.at(0,2) = bs;
01842             mb.at(2,2) = bc;
01843 
01844             mc.at(0,0) = cc;
01845             mc.at(1,0) = cs;
01846             mc.at(0,1) = -cs;
01847             mc.at(1,1) = cc;
01848 
01849             /*std::cout << "RotVec = " << a << "," << b << "," << c << std::endl;
01850               std::cout << "Rx = " << std::endl << ma;
01851               std::cout << "Ry = " << std::endl << mb;
01852               std::cout << "Rz = " << std::endl << mc;*/
01853                 
01854             Matrix4<T> ret = ma * mb * mc;
01855             //std::cout << "Result = " << std::endl << ma * (mb * mc);
01856                 
01857             return ret;
01858          }
01859 
01861 
01868          static Matrix4<T> createTranslation(T x, T y, T z, T w = 1)
01869          {
01870             Matrix4 ret;
01871             ret.at(3,0) = x;
01872             ret.at(3,1) = y;
01873             ret.at(3,2) = z;
01874             ret.at(3,3) = w;
01875                 
01876             return ret;
01877          }
01878 
01879 
01880          //---------------------[ equiality operators ]------------------------------   
01889          bool operator==(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
01890          {
01891             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01892             {
01893                if (std::fabs(data[i] - rhs.data[i]) >= EPSILON)
01894                   return false;
01895             }
01896             return true;
01897          }
01898         
01904          bool operator!=(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
01905          {
01906             return !(*this == rhs);
01907          }
01908         
01909 
01910          //---------------------[ access operators ]---------------------------------
01916          T& at(int x, int y) 
01917          {
01918             assert(x >= 0 && x < 4);
01919             assert(y >= 0 && y < 4);
01920             return data[x * 4 + y];
01921          }
01922 
01928          const T& at(int x, int y) const 
01929          {
01930             assert(x >= 0 && x < 4);
01931             assert(y >= 0 && y < 4);
01932             return data[x * 4 + y];
01933          }
01934 
01935 
01941          void setTranslation(const Vector3<T>& v)
01942          {
01943             at(3,0) = v.x;
01944             at(3,1) = v.y;
01945             at(3,2) = v.z;
01946             at(3,3) = 1;
01947          }
01948 
01949          Vector3<T> getTranslation()
01950          { return Vector3<T>(at(3,0),at(3,1),at(3,2)); }
01951 
01957          void setRotation(const Matrix3<T>& m)
01958          {
01959             for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
01960             {
01961                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
01962                {
01963                   at(i,j) = m.at(i,j);
01964                }
01965             }
01966          }
01967                                  
01968 
01973          Matrix4<T>& operator=(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) 
01974          {
01975             std::memcpy(data, rhs.data, sizeof(T) * 16);
01976             return * this;
01977          }
01978 
01983          template <class FromT>
01984          Matrix4<T>& operator=(const Matrix4<FromT>& rhs) 
01985          {
01986             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
01987             {
01988                data[i] = static_cast<T>(rhs.data[i]);
01989             }
01990             return * this;
01991          }
01992 
01997          Matrix4<T>& operator=(const T* rhs) 
01998          {
01999             std::memcpy(data, rhs, sizeof(T) * 16);
02000             return * this;
02001          }
02002 
02003          /*Matrix4<T> & operator=(const double* m)
02004            {
02005            for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++) data[i] = (T)m[i];
02006            return * this;
02007            }*/
02008         
02009          //--------------------[ matrix with matrix operations ]---------------------
02014          Matrix4<T> operator+(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02015          {
02016             Matrix4<T> ret;
02017             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02018                ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs.data[i];
02019             return ret;
02020          }
02021         
02026          Matrix4<T> operator-(const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02027          {
02028             Matrix4<T> ret;
02029             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02030                ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs.data[i];
02031             return ret;
02032          }
02033         
02034          //--------------------[ matrix with scalar operations ]---------------------
02039          Matrix4<T> operator+(T rhs) const
02040          {
02041             Matrix4<T> ret;
02042             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02043                ret.data[i] = data[i] + rhs;
02044             return ret;
02045          }
02046         
02051          Matrix4<T> operator-(T rhs) const
02052          {
02053             Matrix4<T> ret;
02054             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02055                ret.data[i] = data[i] - rhs;
02056             return ret;
02057          }
02058         
02063          Matrix4<T> operator*(T rhs) const
02064          {
02065             Matrix4<T> ret;
02066             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02067                ret.data[i] = data[i] * rhs;
02068             return ret;
02069          }
02070         
02075          Matrix4<T> operator/(T rhs) const
02076          {
02077             Matrix4<T> ret;
02078             for (int i = 0; i < 16; i++)
02079                ret.data[i] = data[i] / rhs;
02080             return ret;
02081          }
02082         
02083 
02084          //--------------------[ multiply operators ]--------------------------------
02089          Vector4<T> operator*(const Vector4<T>& rhs) const 
02090          {
02091             return Vector4<T>(
02092                data[0] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[8]  * rhs.z + data[12] * rhs.w,
02093                data[1] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[9]  * rhs.z + data[13] * rhs.w,
02094                data[2] * rhs.x + data[6] * rhs.y + data[10] * rhs.z + data[14] * rhs.w,
02095                data[3] * rhs.x + data[7] * rhs.y + data[11] * rhs.z + data[15] * rhs.w
02096                );
02097 
02098          }
02099         
02104          Vector3<T> operator*(const Vector3<T>& rhs) const
02105          {
02106             return Vector3<T>(
02107                data[0] * rhs.x + data[4] * rhs.y + data[8] * rhs.z,
02108                data[1] * rhs.x + data[5] * rhs.y + data[9] * rhs.z,
02109                data[2] * rhs.x + data[6] * rhs.y + data[10] * rhs.z
02110                );
02111          }
02112 
02117          Matrix4<T> operator*(Matrix4<T> rhs) const 
02118          {
02119             static Matrix4<T> w;
02120             for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) 
02121             {
02122                for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++) 
02123                {
02124                   T n = 0;
02125                   for (int k = 0; k < 4; k++) n += rhs.at(i, k) * at(k, j);
02126                   w.at(i, j) = n;
02127                }
02128             }
02129             return w;
02130                 
02131          }
02132         
02133         
02134          //---------------------------[ misc operations ]----------------------------
02138          Matrix4<T> transpose()
02139          {
02140             Matrix4<T> ret;
02141             for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02142             {
02143                for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
02144                {
02145                   ret.at(i,j) = at(j,i);
02146                }
02147             }
02148             return ret;
02149          }
02150         
02156          Matrix4<T> invertTransform()
02157          {
02158             Matrix4<T> ret;
02159                 
02160             // inverse translation
02161             ret.at(3,0) = -at(3,0);
02162             ret.at(3,1) = -at(3,1);
02163             ret.at(3,2) = -at(3,2);
02164             ret.at(3,3) = at(3,3);
02165                 
02166             // transpose rotation part
02167             for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02168             {
02169                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++)
02170                {
02171                   ret.at(i,j) = at(j,i);
02172                }
02173             }
02174                 
02175             return ret;
02176          }
02177         
02187          Matrix4<T> lerp(T fact, const Matrix4<T>& rhs) const
02188          {
02189             Matrix4<T> ret = (*this) + (rhs - (*this)) * fact;
02190             return ret;         
02191          }
02192 
02193     
02194          //-------------[ conversion ]-----------------------------
02200          operator T*(){ return (T*) data; }
02201         
02207          operator const T*() const { return (const T*) data; }
02208 
02209          //----------[ output operator ]----------------------------
02216          friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& lhs, const Matrix4<T>& rhs) 
02217          {
02218             for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++)
02219             {
02220                lhs << "|\t";
02221                for (int j = 0; j < 4; j++)
02222                {
02223                   lhs << rhs.at(j,i) << "\t";
02224                }
02225                lhs << "|" << std::endl;
02226             }
02227             return lhs;
02228          }
02229     
02230    };

02234    typedef Matrix4<float> Matrix4f;
02236    typedef Matrix4<double> Matrix4d;

02238 
02246    template <class T>
02247    class Quaternion
02248    {
02249       public:
02253          T w;
02257          Vector3<T> v;
02258         
02262          Quaternion(): w(0), v(0,0,0){}
02263         
02267          Quaternion(const Quaternion<T>& q): w(q.w), v(q.v){    }
02268 
02272          template <class FromT>
02273          Quaternion(const Quaternion<FromT>& q)
02274             : w(static_cast<T>(q.w)), 
02275               v(q.v){   }
02276 
02277         
02283          Quaternion(T w_, const Vector3<T>& v_): w(w_), v(v_){}
02284         
02292          Quaternion(T w_, T x, T y, T z): w(w_), v(x,y,z){}
02293         
02298          Quaternion<T>& operator= (const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02299          {
02300             v = rhs.v;
02301             w = rhs.w;
02302             return *this;
02303          }
02304 
02309          template<class FromT>
02310          Quaternion<T>& operator= (const Quaternion<FromT>& rhs)
02311          {
02312             v = rhs.v;
02313             w = static_cast<T>(rhs.w);
02314             return *this;
02315          }
02316         
02321          Quaternion<T> operator+ (const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02322          {
02323             const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02324             return Quaternion<T>(lhs.w + rhs.w, lhs.v + rhs.v);  
02325          }
02326         
02331          Quaternion<T> operator* (const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02332          {
02333             const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02334             return Quaternion<T>(
02335                lhs.w * rhs.w            - lhs.v.x * rhs.v.x     - lhs.v.y * rhs.v.y     - lhs.v.z * rhs.v.z,
02336                lhs.w * rhs.v.x  + lhs.v.x * rhs.w               + lhs.v.y * rhs.v.z             - lhs.v.z * rhs.v.y,
02337                lhs.w * rhs.v.y  - lhs.v.x * rhs.v.z             + lhs.v.y * rhs.w               - lhs.v.z * rhs.v.x,
02338                lhs.w * rhs.v.z          + lhs.v.x * rhs.v.y             - lhs.v.y * rhs.v.x             + lhs.v.z * rhs.w
02339                );
02340          }
02341         
02346          Quaternion<T> operator* (T rhs) const 
02347          { 
02348             return Quaternion<T>(w*rhs, v*rhs);
02349          }
02350         
02355          Quaternion<T> operator- (const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02356          {
02357             const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02358             return Quaternion<T>(lhs.w - rhs.w, lhs.v - rhs.v);
02359          }
02360         
02365          Quaternion<T>& operator+= (const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02366          {
02367             w += rhs.w;
02368             v += rhs.v;
02369             return *this;
02370          }
02371         
02376          Quaternion<T>& operator-= (const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02377          {
02378             w -= rhs.w;
02379             v -= rhs.v;
02380             return *this;
02381          }
02382 
02387          Quaternion<T>& operator*= (const Quaternion<T>& rhs)
02388          {
02389             Quaternion q = (*this) * rhs;
02390             v = q.v;
02391             w = q.w;
02392             return *this;
02393          }
02394         
02399          Quaternion<T>& operator*= (T rhs)
02400          {
02401             w *= rhs;
02402             v *= rhs;
02403             return *this;
02404          }
02405 
02413          bool operator==(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02414          {
02415             const Quaternion<T>& lhs = *this;
02416             return (std::fabs(lhs.w - rhs.w) < EPSILON) && lhs.v == rhs.v;
02417          }
02418         
02424          bool operator!=(const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const { return ! (*this == rhs); }
02425 
02430          T length()
02431          {
02432             return (T)std::sqrt(w*w + v.lengthSq());    
02433          }
02434         
02442          T lengthSq()
02443          {
02444             return w * w + v.lengthSq();        
02445          }
02446         
02447         
02451          void normalize()
02452          {
02453             T len = length();
02454             w /= len;
02455             v /= len;
02456          }
02457         
02465          static Quaternion<T> fromEulerAngles(T x, T y, T z)
02466          {
02467             Quaternion<T> ret = fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(1,0,0), x)
02468                * fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(0,1,0),y) * fromAxisRot(Vector3<T>(0,0,1),z);
02469             return ret;
02470          }
02471         
02477          static Quaternion<T> fromAxisRot(Vector3<T> axis, float angleDeg)
02478          {
02479             double angleRad = DEG2RAD(angleDeg);
02480             double sa2 = std::sin(angleRad/2);
02481             double ca2 = std::cos(angleRad/2);
02482             return Quaternion<T>( ca2, axis * sa2);
02483          }
02484         
02489          Matrix3<T> rotMatrix()
02490          {
02491             Matrix3<T> ret;
02492                 
02493             /*ret.at(0,0) = 1 - 2*v.y*v.y - 2*v.z*v.z;
02494               ret.at(1,0) = 2*v.x*v.y - 2*w*v.z;
02495               ret.at(2,0) = 2*v.x*v.z - 2*w*v.y;
02496                 
02497               ret.at(0,1) = 2*v.x*v.y + 2*w*v.z;
02498               ret.at(1,1) = 1 - 2*v.x*v.x - 2*v.z*v.z;
02499               ret.at(2,1) = 2*v.y*v.z - 2*w*v.x;
02500                 
02501               ret.at(0,2) = 2*v.x*v.z - 2*w*v.y;
02502               ret.at(1,2) = 2*v.y*v.z + 2*w*v.x;
02503               ret.at(2,2) = 1 - 2*v.x*v.x - 2*v.y*v.y;*/
02504                 
02505             T xx = v.x * v.x;
02506             T xy = v.x * v.y;
02507             T xz = v.x * v.z;
02508             T xw = v.x * w;
02509                 
02510             T yy = v.y * v.y;
02511             T yz = v.y * v.z;
02512             T yw = v.y * w;
02513                 
02514             T zz = v.z * v.z;
02515             T zw = v.z * w;
02516                 
02517             ret.at(0,0) = 1 - 2 * (yy + zz);
02518             ret.at(1,0) = 2 * (xy - zw);
02519             ret.at(2,0) = 2 * (xz + yw);
02520                 
02521             ret.at(0,1) = 2 * (xy + zw);
02522             ret.at(1,1) = 1 - 2 * (xx + zz);
02523             ret.at(2,1) = 2 * (yz - xw);
02524                 
02525             ret.at(0,2) = 2 * (xz - yw);
02526             ret.at(1,2) = 2 * (yz + xw);
02527             ret.at(2,2) = 1 - 2 * (xx + yy);
02528                 
02529                 
02530             return ret;
02531          }
02532         
02539          Matrix4<T> transform()
02540          {
02541             Matrix4<T> ret;
02542                 
02543             T xx = v.x * v.x;
02544             T xy = v.x * v.y;
02545             T xz = v.x * v.z;
02546             T xw = v.x * w;
02547                 
02548             T yy = v.y * v.y;
02549             T yz = v.y * v.z;
02550             T yw = v.y * w;
02551                 
02552             T zz = v.z * v.z;
02553             T zw = v.z * w;
02554                 
02555             ret.at(0,0) = 1 - 2 * (yy + zz);
02556             ret.at(1,0) = 2 * (xy - zw);
02557             ret.at(2,0) = 2 * (xz + yw);
02558             ret.at(3,0) = 0;
02559                 
02560             ret.at(0,1) = 2 * (xy + zw);
02561             ret.at(1,1) = 1 - 2 * (xx + zz);
02562             ret.at(2,1) = 2 * (yz - xw);
02563             ret.at(3,1) = 0;
02564                 
02565             ret.at(0,2) = 2 * (xz - yw);
02566             ret.at(1,2) = 2 * (yz + xw);
02567             ret.at(2,2) = 1 - 2 * (xx + yy);
02568             ret.at(3,2) = 0;
02569 
02570             ret.at(0,3) = 0;
02571             ret.at(1,3) = 0;
02572             ret.at(2,3) = 0;
02573             ret.at(3,3) = 1;
02574                 
02575             return ret;
02576                 
02577          }
02578 
02588          Quaternion<T> lerp(T fact, const Quaternion<T>& rhs) const
02589          {
02590             return Quaternion<T>((1-fact) * w + fact * rhs.w, v.lerp(fact, rhs.v));
02591          }

02596          friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& oss, const Quaternion<T>& q)
02597          {
02598             oss << "Re: " << q.w << " Im: " << q.v;
02599             return oss;
02600          }

02608          static Quaternion<T> fromMatrix(const Matrix4<T>& m)
02609          {
02610             Quaternion<T> q;
02611                                                 
02612             T tr,s;
02613             tr = m.at(0,0) + m.at(1,1) + m.at(2,2);
02614             if (tr >= epsilon)
02615             {
02616                s = (T)sqrt(tr + 1);
02617                q.w = 0.5 * s;
02618                s = 0.5 / s;
02619                                                          
02620                q.v.x = (m.at(1,2) - m.at(2,1)) * s;
02621                q.v.y = (m.at(2,0) - m.at(0,2)) * s;
02622                q.v.z = (m.at(0,1) - m.at(1,0)) * s;
02623             }
02624             else
02625             {
02626                T d0 = m.at(0,0);
02627                T d1 = m.at(1,1);
02628                T d2 = m.at(2,2);
02629                                                          
02630                char bigIdx = (d0 > d1) ? ((d0 > d2)? 0 : 2) : ((d1 > d2) ? 1 : 2);
02631                                                          
02632                if (bigIdx == 0)
02633                {
02634                   s = (T)sqrt((d0 - (d1 + d2)) + 1);
02635                                                                         
02636                   q.v.x = 0.5 * s;
02637                   s = 0.5 / s;
02638                   q.v.y = (m.at(1,0) + m.at(0,1)) * s;
02639                   q.v.z = (m.at(2,0) + m.at(0,2)) * s;
02640                   q.w = (m.at(1,2) - m.at(2,1)) * s;
02641                }
02642                else if (bigIdx == 1)
02643                {
02644                   s = (T)sqrt(1 + d1 - (d0 + d2));
02645                   q.v.y = 0.5 * s;
02646                   s = 0.5 / s;
02647                   q.v.z = (m.at(2,1) + m.at(1,2)) / s;
02648                   q.w = (m.at(2,0) - m.at(0,2)) / s;
02649                   q.v.x = (m.at(1,0) + m.at(0,1)) / s;
02650                }
02651                else
02652                {
02653                   s = (T)sqrt(1 + d2 - (d0 + d1));
02654                   q.v.z = 0.5 * s;
02655                   s = 0.5 / s;
02656                   q.w = (m.at(0,1) - m.at(1,0)) / s;
02657                   q.v.x = (m.at(2,0) + m.at(0,2)) / s;
02658                   q.v.y = (m.at(2,1) + m.at(1,2)) / s;
02659                }
02660             }
02661                                                 
02662             return q;
02663          }
02664                                  
02671          static Quaternion<T> fromMatrix(const Matrix3<T>& m)
02672          {
02673             Quaternion<T> q;
02674                                                 
02675             T tr,s;
02676             tr = m.at(0,0) + m.at(1,1) + m.at(2,2);
02677             // if trace is greater or equal then zero
02678             if (tr >= epsilon)
02679             {
02680                s = (T)sqrt(tr + 1);
02681                q.w = 0.5 * s;
02682                s = 0.5 / s;
02683                                                          
02684                q.v.x = (m.at(1,2) - m.at(2,1)) * s;
02685                q.v.y = (m.at(2,0) - m.at(0,2)) * s;
02686                q.v.z = (m.at(0,1) - m.at(1,0)) * s;
02687             }
02688             else
02689             {
02690                T d0 = m.at(0,0);
02691                T d1 = m.at(1,1);
02692                T d2 = m.at(2,2);
02693                                                          
02694                // find greates diagonal number
02695                char bigIdx = (d0 > d1) ? ((d0 > d2)? 0 : 2) : ((d1 > d2) ? 1 : 2);
02696                                                          
02697                if (bigIdx == 0)
02698                {
02699                   s = (T)sqrt((d0 - (d1 + d2)) + 1);
02700                                                                         
02701                   q.v.x = 0.5 * s;
02702                   s = 0.5 / s;
02703                   q.v.y = (m.at(1,0) + m.at(0,1)) * s;
02704                   q.v.z = (m.at(2,0) + m.at(0,2)) * s;
02705                   q.w = (m.at(1,2) - m.at(2,1)) * s;
02706                }
02707                else if (bigIdx == 1)
02708                {
02709                   s = (T)sqrt(1 + d1 - (d0 + d2));
02710                   q.v.y = 0.5 * s;
02711                   s = 0.5 / s;
02712                   q.v.z = (m.at(2,1) + m.at(1,2)) / s;
02713                   q.w = (m.at(2,0) - m.at(0,2)) / s;
02714                   q.v.x = (m.at(1,0) + m.at(0,1)) / s;
02715                }
02716                else
02717                {
02718                   s = (T)sqrt(1 + d2 - (d0 + d1));
02719                   q.v.z = 0.5 * s;
02720                   s = 0.5 / s;
02721                   q.w = (m.at(0,1) - m.at(1,0)) / s;
02722                   q.v.x = (m.at(2,0) + m.at(0,2)) / s;
02723                   q.v.y = (m.at(2,1) + m.at(1,2)) / s;
02724                }
02725             }
02726                                                 
02727             return q;
02728          }
02729 
02738          Quaternion<T> slerp(T r, const Quaternion<T>& q2) const 
02739          {
02740             Quaternion<T> ret;
02741             T cosTheta = w * q2.w + v.x * q2.v.x + v.y *q2.v.y + v.z * q2.v.z;
02742             T theta = (T) acos(cosTheta);
02743             if (fabs(theta) < epsilon)
02744             {
02745                ret = *this;
02746             }
02747             else
02748             {
02749                T sinTheta = (T)sqrt(1.0 - cosTheta * cosTheta);
02750                if (fabs(sinTheta) < epsilon)
02751                {
02752                   ret.w = 0.5 * w + 0.5 * q2.w;
02753                   ret.v = v.lerp(0.5, q2.v);
02754                }
02755                else
02756                {
02757                   T rA = (T)sin((1.0 - r) * theta) / sinTheta;
02758                   T rB = (T)sin(r * theta) / sinTheta;
02759                                                                         
02760                   ret.w = w * rA + q2.w * rB;
02761                   ret.v.x = v.x * rA + q2.v.x * rB;
02762                   ret.v.y = v.y * rA + q2.v.y * rB;
02763                   ret.v.z = v.z * rA + q2.v.z * rB;
02764                }
02765             }
02766             return ret;
02767          }
02768
